intro: Serapias cilentana, commonly known as the Cilento orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to southern Italy. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow and orange flowers with intricate patterns. The plant typically grows in rocky and calcareous soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to its arid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Serapias cilentana is considered a vulnerable species.
